Articles.Content:
I've recently tried installing mods through CKAN, specifically mods for part of Realism overhaul 1.7.3, however whenever I place a procedural part on my rocket and launch it, the part itself seems to be pinned still in space time, and refuses to be moved at all, even under the full throttle of my engines, it just kind of remains stuck where it is hovering above the ground, dangling. 

I'm not a very tech savvy person, and I have no clue how mods work in the first place, so this bug has me completely stumped. I have all the dependencies for all of my mods, and none of them say they have issues with procedural parts, yet this still happens, making it impossible to make any decent small scale rockets

On 12/1/2019 at 8:21 AM, GeneralToast said:

I've recently tried installing mods through CKAN, specifically mods for part of Realism overhaul 1.7.3, however whenever I place a procedural part on my rocket and launch it, the part itself seems to be pinned still in space time, and refuses to be moved at all, even under the full throttle of my engines, it just kind of remains stuck where it is hovering above the ground, dangling. 

I'm not a very tech savvy person, and I have no clue how mods work in the first place, so this bug has me completely stumped. I have all the dependencies for all of my mods, and none of them say they have issues with procedural parts, yet this still happens, making it impossible to make any decent small scale rockets

Do you have latest Proc Parts from here: https://github.com/KSP-RO/ProceduralParts/releases ?

Edited December 4, 2019 by Flibble
